basics.name: Terry Tong
basics.label: Undergraduate Student in Computer Science & Engineering
basics.summary: Undergraduate student at UC Davis majoring in Computer Science and Engineering with research interests in Statistical ML, NLP, and Trustworthy AI. Experienced in academic research, paper reviewing, and project leadership.

work.name: Academic Services
work.summary: Reviewed papers for EMNLP-2024, ICLR-2025, NAACL-2025, and ACL-2025; supported the Amazon Trustworthy AI Challenge Fellowship proposal.

awards.title: International Amazon Trustworthy AI Fellow
awards.summary: Awarded for contributions in Trustworthy AI with a 250k grant.

awards.title: 2025 CRA Outstanding Undergraduate Researcher Award Honorable Mention
awards.summary: Honorable mention for outstanding undergraduate research.

awards.title: UC Davis Hong Kong Undergraduate Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded for academic excellence, amounting to 4k.

awards.title: UC Davis Vincent V.C. Woo Undergraduate Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded for academic performance, amounting to 3k.

awards.title: UC Davis James Leung Family Endowed UG Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded for academic excellence, amounting to 2k.

awards.title: UC Davis Dean Witter / Student Development Fund
awards.summary: Award of $500 from the Dean Witter / Student Development Fund.

awards.title: Dean's Honor Roll
awards.summary: Maintained position on the Dean's Honor Roll three times.

awards.title: Chairman's Award for Excellence, 45/45 IB, KGV High School
awards.summary: Received the Chairman's Award for excellence.

publications.name: BadJudge: Backdoor Vulnerabilities of LLM-as-a-Judge
publications.summary: Identified vulnerability in the NLP evaluation pipeline with automatic judges; proposed a principled defense reducing attack success rate to ~0% and achieving state-of-the-art evaluation performance.

publications.name: Securing Multi-turn Conversational Language Models from Distributed Backdoor Attacks
publications.summary: Exposed a threat to multi-turn chatbots with a 97%+ attack success rate and proposed a novel linear-time defense reducing ASR to as low as 0.36%.

publications.name: Mitigating Backdoor Threats to Large Language Models: Advancement and Challenges
publications.summary: Analyzed backdoor attacks in large language models, covering both training-time and test-time threats, and proposed mitigation strategies.

references.name: Prof. Muhao Chen
references.reference: Ph.D. advisor at UC Davis and expert in Statistical ML and NLP. Available upon request.

references.name: Prof. Zhe Zhao
references.reference: Faculty advisor at UC Davis specializing in Trustworthy AI. Available upon request.

projects.name: ISVP: Influence Selection via Proxy for Efficient Preference Adaptation
projects.summary: Developing influence functions for preference adaptation with a novel derivation and methodology to approximate test-time loss using unobserved preference data.

projects.name: Influence Functions for Indirect and Noisy In-Context Learning
projects.summary: Exploring the application of influence functions in in-context learning with indirect and noisy signals, including an EKFAC influence function approach.
